tout.caption: Musician Otomo Yoshihide of Japan plays at a studio in Brooklyn, New York, on May 12, 2016.The fluid cultural exchanges of modern Europe have mostly eluded Asia, where political barriers remain entrenched. But a group of Asian musicians has discovered harmony in, of all places, noise.Calling themselves the Far East Network, the quartet loosely revolves around Otomo Yoshihide, a leading force in Japan's onkyo-kei scene of experimental noise rock that emerged in Tokyo in the late 1990s. / AFP / Jewel SAMAD / TO GO WITH AFP STORY BY SHAUN TANDON- "Asian ensemble finds harmony in noise"        (Photo credit should read JEWEL SAMAD/AFP/Getty Images)
